subject: RE: [junit] Need help on : API Testing using jUnit
msgSnippet: Hi,     I am also found  macrotesting www.macrotesting.com to be very good source for JUnit testing free tools, documents, kb article.etc., cheers Prem ...
messageBody:
Hi,
    I am also found  macrotesting www.macrotesting.com to be very good source for JUnit testing free tools, documents, kb article.etc.,

cheers
Prem

--- On Mon, 3/8/09, Bradley, Todd <todd.bradley@...> wrote:

From: Bradley, Todd <todd.bradley@...>
Subject: RE: [junit] Need help on : API Testing using jUnit
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Date: Monday, 3 August, 2009, 5:03 PM






 





JUnit already is a framework for testing Java APIs. All you have to do

is write test cases in Java that exercise the API you want to test, and

then use JUnit methods to check that the API returns what you expected.



Cheers,

Todd.





> -----Original Message-----

> From: junit@yahoogroups. com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups. com] On

> Behalf Of krishna.punekar

> Sent: Monday, August 03, 2009 1:34 AM

> To: junit@yahoogroups. com

> Subject: [junit] Need help on : API Testing using jUnit

>

> Hi,

> I am new to API testing

> Came to know that, jUnit test framework can also be used to

> build the API testing harness.

> Can you please guide me, as to how to use jUnit to develop a

> framework for testing API's (The API's are written in java).

>

>

>
